thread.title: Krauthammer: Obama’s Accomplishments ‘Built on Sand’ Because He Didn’t Bring in the Opposition
thread.title_full: Krauthammer: Obama’s Accomplishments ‘Built on Sand’ Because He Didn’t Bring in the Opposition

author: Josh Feldman
title: Krauthammer: Obama’s Accomplishments ‘Built on Sand’ Because He Didn’t Bring in the Opposition
text:
Krauthammer: Obama’s Accomplishments ‘Built on Sand’ Because He Didn’t Bring in the Opposition by Josh Feldman | 7:32 pm, January 16th, 2017 video 
On Fox’s Special Report tonight, Charles Krauthammer reacted to how President Obama is reflecting on his legacy. Like most presidents, he said, Obama has “deluded” himself into thinking he was a great success. 
And while he accomplished a lot, Krauthammer argued that “they’re all built on sand” because “he never brought in the opposition, he never brought in the country.” 
He thinks Obama “completely overshot” his 2008 mandate and his early presidency basically made him “ Bernie Sanders before Sanders was Sanders.” 
Obama recently argued that he tried working with Republicans, but they were too resistant. He partly attributed that to conservative media outlets . 
Watch above, via Fox News. 
[ image via screengrab ]
